Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • AddressBook
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AddressBook
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    JPanel which has text fields to enter data and buttons to add records, submit records, and see records.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    J Levy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBook()
      The class constructor sets up the JPanel with a FlowLayout, adds the record counter, and calls addComponents() and outputResult()

      • openFile

        public void openFile()
        Opens an address book file with a .xd extension

        Local variables:

        fileChooser JFileChooser to choose a file

        filter FileNameExtensionFilter to use as an extension filter

        input BufferedReader to read from a file

        numInFile int number of records stored in the file

      • saveFile

        public void saveFile()
        Saves the records into a .xd file

        Local variables:

        output PrintWriter to write to a file

      • saveAsFile

        public void saveAsFile()
        Saves the records into a .xd file with a given name

        Local variables:

        fileChooser JFileChooser to choose a file

        filter FileNameExtensionFilter to use as an extension filter

        reply int reply to hold save dialog response

        public void emergencySave()

      • addComponents

        public void addComponents()
        Adds JLabels, JTextFields, and JButtons to the JPanel

        Local variables:

        firstLabel JLabel for first name

        lastLabel JLabel for last name

        phoneLabel JLabel for phone number

        emailLabel JLabel for email address

        submitButton JButton for submitting

        newRecordButton JButton for creating a new record

        leftButton JButton for moving left in the records

        rightButton JButton for moving right in the records
